title: "P3 Impact Creation Workplan Review
segmentation: Not try to make it so difficult.
We are actually happy as people who work on business models and innovation that we're kind of accepted on the table.
In this projects, we've heard a lot about P1 and P2, which is the.
The technical developments and a lot of expectation has been put on something.
Which is called business models.
And the project 3 is defined to create impact whatever that means.
And I think that is what we have to find out.
But for me it's a bit.
The wake up call to say we should not only develop nice technology and make a couple of nice pilots and experiments and prototypes.
But that we should tell outside the world, and that we change and implement things that really there's some business impact.
And we've heard this morning that it must be, you know, not only technology, but easier to use.
And a couple of other things.
That's why this Project 3 has two objectives.
One is that we should tell the world that we are there.
So that means that we should reach out to the business and research communities which are not inside the projects but go outside and talk to people so that people are aware of the concepts.
That is pretty standard in this kind of projects.

And we've got a second objective, and I think this is a bit of a new objective, which is that we should define suitable business models involving all private and public stakeholders so that we get into a sustainable collaboration.
This is something which at least I have not yet seen in an European project as a task.
So in that sense, it's new for me and I think it has something to do with the changed objectives of the research framework, which always has been on technical excellence.
And now we've got this ship.
Objective, which is competitiveness and innovation.
But inside behind this is that we in Europe will champions and producing patterns, and typically what we do when we make a patent, we staple it.
We put it in the folder and we make the next patent.
But patterns actually is away.
You know making patterns as a way of turning money into knowledge.
And now people say we should have the other way around.
Take the pattern, takes a knowledge and turn it back into money.
And if that is a bit of the definition, my own working definition of what impact creation could be.

Can you make a product of it out of it?

Business planning activities was clearly discouraged.
So in that sense you were asking something which is new to consults here into the community.

Called them precompetitive better prototypes and this kind of things because otherwise it wouldn't have been acceptable, so funding, so there's still a lot of that's what I would say is.
Boot into the routines and procedures and the as well inside the Commission.
I'm very much in favor of that.
We have to get this out and that we have to keep to integrate this in what we call Living labs or open innovation type of things.
